nybg:

Ran across this poster in the 14th Street tunnel last week. It literally stopped me in my tracks, forced me to back up, and stand there like a gape-mouthed nerd; itâs so beautiful! Also, itâs 100% true. Getting to the Botanical Garden via public transportation is super easy. Just hop onto a Metro-North Railroad Harlem line train and get whisked to our very own Botanical Garden station in about 22 minutes! Trust me, I do it every morning, and itâs seamless. Also, if you have a train obsessed toddler itâs a fantastic way to make a trip to the Holiday Train Show a holistic train experience! ~AR

artsfortransit:

Have you noticed our newest poster in the subway system yet? Artist Jennifer Judd-McGee created the Botanical poster as a papercut, crafting a flourishing and beautiful pattern.

âA wild dance of flowers brightens the lives of riders in Jennifer Judd-McGeeâs papercut, reminding us of our natural riches. See the real thing at one of the many botanical gardens and nature centers in New York City and across the MTAâs service region-many within easy reach by mass transit.â
